caption.p: Atypical CT imaging of a 56-year-old female presented with a history of 3 days of persistent fever. Laboratory findings: reduced total protein level (54.0 g/L), reduced albumin value (35.5 g/L), low value of globulin (18.5 g/L), white blood cells (WBCs) (4.87 × 10 9/L), lymphocytes (0.49 × 10 9/ L), and decreased level of eosinophil (0 × 10 9/L). Imaging inspection: ( A) A lateral section of the center of right lung lobe covered GGO. ( B) Patchy GGO in the upper part of the right lung with sporadic consolidated lesions. ( C) GGO in both lungs with sporadic consolidation lesions. ( D) Uneven GGO in the middle and dorsal section of the right lung. Adopted from Kui et al. through open-access license [ 69].
